title: Dutch Orienteering Federation
text:
The Dutch Orienteering Federation (, NOLB) is the national Orienteering <a href="Sport%20governing%20body">Association</a> in the <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>. It is recognized as the <a href="orienteering">orienteering</a> <a href="Sport%20governing%20body">association</a> for the Netherlands by the <a href="International%20Orienteering%20Federation">International Orienteering Federation</a>, of which it is a member.
NOLB stands for "Nederlandse OriënteringsLoop Bond", this is Dutch for "Dutch Orienteering Federation". NOLB was founded on 12 December 1982, at first it acted as an <a href="orienteering">orienteering</a> club. But after ten years the organisational structure was changed. NOLB has nowadays (December 2018) about 430 members divided over 5 <a href="orienteering">orienteering</a> <a href="Sport%20club">clubs</a>.
